content.description: Trouble Hunters is the first route on the northern face.  Follow nice crimps up solid holds scary high ball. Slightly overhung holds. Best warm up for area crux is on the upper part.
content.location: First route on the face of the biblical boulder

content.description: Starts around the corner on the east overhang on The Biblical Boulder. Start around the corner and proceed up and slightly left up the overhang. Good holds just far apart and pumpy. Some holds are pretty slick.
content.location: When facing the Biblical Boulder this route is on the east overhang.

content.description: Where Is My Mind? is a great bouldery route on good holds that are right where you want them. Steep slightly overhung route. Few mild 5.12 moves towards the top its a mantle to the top. Great route!
content.location: To the left of Schizophrenia. Follows up the left corner of the overhanging prow.

content.description: Sit start on the left side of the Boulder. Traverse right eliminating the top of the boulder. Finish by mantling onto the pad of rock right of the boulder (crux).
Route to the left of Trouble Hunters around the corner. Blank face pads required sketchy landing.
content.location: To the left and around the corner from trouble hunters

content.description: The Biblical boulder is the largest boulder in the Northern Park and possibly Palisades State Park. The MWC ( Minne-Waken Cove a.k.a. Holy Cove) is a beautiful bouldering area if you wish to escape the crowds or feel like an adrenaline rush this would be the spot for you. Peaceful and yet untouched lets help to keep this area as clean as we can. Most of the Climbs in the area feature small crimp holds as well as sloping jug holds. All the routes on this boulder are HIGHBALLS sometimes feel like mini free solos.
